poem:
"In the Measure of Minds"

In the heart of Albion a sigh unthreads,  
Metric and imperial, duel in silent dread.  
568 milliliters, a pint of wine,  
Unreason in numbers, a jester's sign.  
The plaza and the pound, frequently misled,  
Echoes of Brexit, in whispers it spreads.  
In this dance of units, lost we tread.  
Lost, in the bellicose story of time and line.
